formalText: They are unsure what is causing their panic.
They don't feel like the Klonopin is helping them get better.
Their partner is doing better other than when they go into a couple of fights last couple of days.
They are having a difficult time with some of the therapy work because they believe they are above it.
They see that their depression lies to them.
And their anxiety is the same way.
Their baseline of anxiety is really high but they need to figure out a way to lower it to improve their panic attacks.
They are going to take time and focus on breathing to try to help lower their baseline.
They have been having panic attacks and stuff.
They think they would be better off dead for everyone else's sake.
Their partner still knows that they won't end their life but it is still driving them crazy.
They want to hurt themself right now.
They don't see a problem with hurting themself if it is just momentarily painful and they don't end their life.
They say they know how to cut themself where it won't result in permanent damage.
They don't feel like they are effectively managing the panic.
Whenever they are not occupied they have a panic attack.
Their condition feels worse when they think it is going to last forever.
They are worried about the fact that their medication does not work in the evening and they still have panic attacks.
But since I have you here today, I thought I'd ask.
They fell asleep fine but then woke up with complete panic 2 and half hours later.
